ProjectTitle: Cytopenia and Autosomal Dominant Polycystic Kidney Disease (ADPKD)
InitialFeedbackHistory:
04/07/2022
2. Data: you can also include your samples in the table, they are considered "physical data". 
4. Metadata: if you are using kws (or redcap) this also generates metadata that you may use and can mention here.  
6. Preservation: please note that the guidelines from the UZL ethical committee recommend 25 years of data preservation. 
7. Sharing: you can also consider using a repository for sharing such as KU Leuven RDR (www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr) RDR gives you data a DOI and metadata which makes it better findable and citable, but you can still restrict access if needed so others have to request access via the repository to view it.
label: good with suggestions
